availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry J. Evans (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Mariah Louisa Lunsford Evans in Madison County, Kentucky, in February 1836. Father of Sarah F. Evans, William H. Evans, John T. Evans, Mary F. Evans, and Martha W. Evans. Married to Harriet Cluke Evans. Father of Benjamin Waller Evans, Samuel Evans, and Ann E. B. Evans. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Methodist episcopal minister in Warren County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
